titleStmt.title: Neural Machine Translation Methods for Translating Text to Sign Language Glosses

sourceDesc.p: Article published in the Proceedings of the 61st Annual Meeting of the Association for Computational Linguistics (ACL 2023).

projectDesc.p:

The article has not been modified and was encoded only for academic learning and evaluation purposes.

abstract.p: State-of-the-art techniques common to low resource machine translation are applied to improve machine translation of spoken language text to sign language glosses. In our experiments, we improve the performance of transformer-based models via (1) data augmentation, (2) semi-supervised neural machine translation, (3) transfer learning and (4) multilingual neural machine translation. The proposed methods are implemented progressively on two German sign language corpora containing gloss annotations. Multilingual neural machine translation combined with data augmentation appears to be the most successful setting, yielding statistically significant improvements as measured by three automatic metrics (up to over 6 BLEU points), and confirmed via human evaluation. Our best setting outperforms all previous work that report on the same test set and is also confirmed on a corpus of American Sign Language.
